page.title: 07RED ROCKS NATURE RESERVE
page.content:
A brackish water marsh area lies between the stabilised dunes of the Royal Liverpool Golf Course and the mobile embryo dunes of the foreshore which have been planted with{Marram {grass. }This reserve is a{Site of {Special Scientific Interest (SSSI), run by the{Cheshire Conservation {Trust. }Plant life is prolific with more than 200 species of flowering plants including{Common Spotted {Orchid, Yellow Rattle, Bedstraw, {Yellow Flags, Phragmites, Quaking {grass}and{Lyme grass.
Red Rocks is one of the 15 British sites where{Natterjack Toads}breed.
Over two hundred species of birds, (170 in 1975) have been recorded from this site, including many{migrant {waders.
